question_sentence: Former President Donald Trump was indicted this week for his alleged efforts to remain in the White House following his 2020 election loss. How many times has Trump been indicted?
evidence: Trump was handed down a third indictment this week, and political analysts say this one may be the most consequential. He was previously indicted for his involvement in a hush-money scheme before he became president and for the alleged mishandling of classified material after he left office.

question_sentence: Which icon fashion designer died this week at the age of 93?
evidence: Fans worldwide have been paying tribute to the British designer, who pioneered the miniskirt. “Only the Beatles are more closely tied to the legend that is London’s swinging 60s than Mary Quant,” said The Guardian.

question_sentence: This week marked 50 years since which major technological milestone?
evidence: On April 3, 1973, the first cell phone call was made on a sidewalk in New York City with a device the size of a brick.

question_sentence: What percentage of millennials (aged 25-40) believe that the Conservatives “deserve to lose the next election”?
evidence: In polling for The Times, 62% of millennials said the Tories deserved to lose the next election. Only 21% said they would vote Conservative if an election were held tomorrow.

question_sentence: Recent shows in Seattle by which music star generated seismic activity equivalent to a 2.3 magnitude earthquake?
Where will the annual Punkin Chunkin World Championship be held this year?
The Financial Conduct Authority announced this week that the UK cap on bankers' bonuses will be lifted when?
evidence: Financial regulators have confirmed that the controversial limit, introduced by the EU in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis, will be lifted from 31 October – almost a year after then chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng announced that the cap would be scrapped.

question_sentence: Who is the Republican candidate seeking the nomination for Delaware's at-large U.S. House of Representatives seat in the upcoming election?
Where did the UK’s first womb transplant take place?
evidence: Surgeons spent eight hours removing the womb of a 40-year-old donor, followed by a further nine hours implanting it into her 34-year-old sister. The transplant, at the Oxford Transplant Centre, has been hailed as the “dawn of a new era” in fertility treatment.

question_sentence: Scientists have revived what animal that was frozen 46,000 years ago?
evidence: The microscopic roundworm, or nematode, had lain dormant in Siberian permafrost since the last Ice Age. It was unearthed from a fossilised squirrel burrow extracted from the northeastern Arctic in 2002.

question_sentence: Which English cricketer was controversially stumped as Australia won the second Ashes Test?
evidence: The stumping by Australia’s Alex Carey triggered uproar among fans, who argued that while allowed under cricket rules, the move was not in the “spirit of the game”. Critics including Geoffrey Boycott have called on Australia to apologise, while the rival team complained of “aggressive and abusive” behaviour by Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) members following Bairstow’s dismissal in Sunday’s second Ashes Test at Lord’s.

question_sentence: Thousands of people participated in a pro-Israel protest this week in which city?
evidence: A massive pro-Israel demonstration took place Tuesday on the National Mall in Washington, DC. The march is believed to be the largest pro-Israel gathering in the US since the start of the Israel-Hamas war.

question_sentence: Which bank agreed to pay its shareholders $1 billion for overstating its progress in recovering from scandals?
evidence: Wells Fargo has agreed to pay $1 billion to settle a lawsuit accusing it of defrauding shareholders over its treatment of customers. Since 2016, Wells Fargo has paid or set aside billions of dollars to resolve regulatory probes and litigation concerning its business practices.

question_sentence: West Virginia suspended men's basketball coach Bob Huggins for three games and cut his salary after he did what?
choices: Used a homophobic slur on the radio
Told a player to fake an injury
Made an obscene gesture on TV

question_sentence: Which decorated gymnast recently won a record eighth all-around national title?
evidence: Simone Biles’ impressive eighth national title this week broke the record she shared with Alfred Jochim, who won his seventh all-around gold medal 90 years ago in 1933.

question_sentence: What has contributed to the high number of vacant positions in the Division of Family Services?
choices: A lack of interest in child protection roles among professionals.
An increase in the number of cases handled by each investigator.
The decrease in the number of child abuse and neglect cases reported.
Difficulties with recruitment and retention, exacerbated by the pandemic.

question_sentence: New research suggests that heart attacks are most likely to happen on what day?
evidence: An analysis of data on 10,528 patients admitted to hospital in Ireland with a serious heart attack over a five-year period found that rates were 13% higher on Mondays. Possible reasons suggested include disruptions to sleep cycles over the weekend that may trigger higher levels of inflammation and stress hormones when people return to their usual weekday rising times.

question_sentence: Millions of people in the US are under air quality alerts this week. What is causing a thick haze drifting across the Northeast, Midwest and Mid-Atlantic?
evidence: Millions of people remain at risk of inhaling potentially harmful air as wildfire smoke originating from Canada shrouds major US cities.

question_sentence: What has concerned residents about Noramco's expansion plans?
choices: The company's intention to reduce emissions
The potential release of toxic compounds and hazardous pollution
The lack of response from the Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control (DNREC)
The absence of the environmental justice coordinator

question_sentence: What is the estimated value of the painting that the woman found in a New Hampshire thrift store, believed to be the work of American master N.C. Wyeth?
Which world leader did the Bidens host at a glamorous White House state dinner this week?
choices: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol
evidence: President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden capped South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s official state visit with a lavish state dinner at the White House Wednesday night to celebrate the two nations’ 70-year alliance.

question_sentence: President Abraham Lincoln’s famous Gettysburg Address in 1863 during the height of the Civil War begins, “Four score and seven years ago …” How long is a score?
evidence: A score is equal to 20 years, so Lincoln was referring to 87 years ago — or 1776 — when the Declaration of Independence was adopted in his address.

question_sentence: Hackers threatened to leak stolen data from which tech company unless it pays a $4.5 million ransom and changes its controversial pricing policy?
evidence: Hackers from a ransomware gang are threatening to leak 80 gigabytes of confidential data from Reddit that they claim to have stolen during a February breach, according to a post from the group on the dark web, which was reviewed by CNN and an independent cybersecurity expert.

question_sentence: Which recalled food was recently linked to a multistate salmonella outbreak?
evidence: The CDC announced a recall of some charcuterie meats that were shipped to Sam’s Club distribution centers. At least 24 illnesses, including five hospitalizations, have been reported across the US.

question_sentence: Preparations are underway for the 2024 Olympic Games. Where will the Games be held?
evidence: Paris is preparing for the 2024 Olympic Games centered around the River Seine. The opening ceremony, which is traditionally held inside the host city’s Olympic stadium, will take place on the river, with at least 600,000 people expected to watch from the banks, according to organizers.

question_sentence: Which fast food chain is closing its first-ever restaurant after more than a half-century in business?
evidence: Chick-fil-A’s first-ever restaurant, located in the Greenbriar Mall food court in Atlanta, is set to close. It’s unclear why the restaurant is closing, but like many malls, the Greenbriar has been struggling to attract shoppers and keep tenants.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new Covid variant triggering a surge of infections in India?
evidence: Omicron subvariant Arcturus was first detected in late January and is being monitored by the World Health Organization as a variant of concern. Cases have been reported in at least 27 countries, including the UK.

question_sentence: Which members of the Royal Family were involved in what they called a “near catastrophic car chase” in New York earlier this week?
choices: Prince William and Catherine, Princess of Wales
Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex
King Charles III and Queen Camilla
evidence: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have said that they were involved in a “near catastrophic car chase” involving paparazzi photographers in New York. In a statement, they described being relentlessly pursued by a gang of paparazzi in blacked-out vehicles for two hours. New York City police confirmed that while the royal couple’s journey was challenging, there were no reported collisions, summonses, injuries or arrests.

question_sentence: What percentage of the world’s population is affected by infertility, according to research from the World Health Organization (WHO)?
evidence: In the WHO’s first estimates of infertility prevalence in more than a decade, it was found that about 17.5% of the global adult population will experience infertility. Based on more than 100 studies between 1990 and 2021, the results show limited variation between regions and between high, middle and low-income countries. “For millions around the world, the path to parenthood can be difficult to access, if not impossible,” said Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the WHO director general.

question_sentence: Who among the following individuals is a three-time state wrestling champion for Tatnall School and later became an All-American center in football at Alabama?
Novak Djokovic's victory in last weekend's ATP Tour Finals finale brings the Serbian tennis champ's total tally of title wins in the season-ending championship to how much?
evidence: Djokovic beat home favourite Jannik Sinner 6-3, 6-3 in the final in the Italian city of Turin on Sunday. The 36-year-old Serb finishes the year as world No.1 for a record eighth time.

question_sentence: Which coffee chain is releasing boozy versions of some of its popular drinks?
evidence: Dunkin’ is turning two of its most popular drinks into boozy beverages.

question_sentence: The citizens of Paris have voted to ban which mode of transport in the French capital?
evidence: Rental e-scooters are to be outlawed in the French capital after a referendum was held last week. Around 89% of votes cast were in support of a ban, but with no online voting, turnout was only about 8%. Nevertheless, the result means Paris will become the first major European capital to outlaw the scooters.

question_sentence: What is scrapple made from and how is it typically prepared?
choices: Scrapple is made from ground beef and is usually served grilled.
Scrapple is made from leftover pig parts, cornmeal, and flour, then sliced and fried until crispy.
Scrapple is a type of cheese made from curdled milk and is often melted on sandwiches.
Scrapple is a type of seafood dish made from lobster and crab, commonly served at festivals.

question_sentence: Which major city has been warned it must stop building skyscrapers and high-rise buildings or it could “sink”, according to a new study?
evidence: New York must stop building skyscrapers or it will sink, a new study has warned. There are thought to be one million buildings in New York City, weighing an estimated 771 million tonnes, and the study, headed by Tom Parsons of the United States Geological Survey, found that the city is “plopping closer” to the water at a rate of 1 to 2mm a year, “with some areas subsiding much faster”, said the New York Post. Lower Manhattan is particularly at risk, and there is heightened concern for both Brooklyn and Queens.

question_sentence: Which actor voices iconic video game plumber Mario in the “Super Mario Bros. Movie,” which was released in theaters this week?
Fox News agreed to pay electronic voting company Dominion how much to settle a defamation lawsuit?
evidence: Fox News avoided a high-profile defamation trial by reaching the last-minute deal with Dominion, concluding two years of litigation over the news network’s airing of false claims that the 2020 US presidential election was rigged.

question_sentence: How many slogans has the Labour Party unveiled in the three years since Keir Starmer became leader?
evidence: The party’s current slogan, “Build a better Britain”, was introduced in March. Recent YouGov polling found that almost half of Britons think Starmer has failed to set out a clear vision for the party in his three years as leader.

question_sentence: Which city lit up the world’s largest spherical structure this week?
evidence: A massive bowl-shaped theater in Las Vegas that reportedly contains the world’s highest-resolution wraparound LED screen was fully illuminated on Tuesday. See its dramatic debut here.

question_sentence: Approximately 4 million people have so far enrolled in President Biden’s new student loan repayment plan. What is the program called?
evidence: Biden’s new repayment plan, known as SAVE (Saving on a Valuable Education), promises to lower borrowers’ monthly bills as student loan payments are set to resume in October.

question_sentence: Following the launch of Meta’s app Threads, which social network saw a major drop in traffic?
evidence: Twitter’s traffic tanked following the launch of Meta’s rival app Threads, which topped more than 100 million users within five days after its debut.

question_sentence: For the first time in nearly 100 years, the iconic Oscar Mayer Wienermobile has been renamed to?
Police have reopened their investigation into the murder of hip-hop legend Tupac Shakur by raiding what?
evidence: Las Vegas police have reopened their investigation into the murder of Tupac Shakur. The rapper was shot in September 1996, aged just 25, in what has become one of America’s most notorious unsolved murder cases. Police raided a house in Henderson, 15 miles southeast of the city, seizing computers, hard drives and pictures, according to ABC News.

question_sentence: People magazine published snippets of Britney Spears' memoir on Tuesday, ahead of its release next week. What is the book called?
evidence: The "bombshell" memoir will share previously undisclosed information about Spears' career and personal life. In one excerpt published this week, she revealed that she had an abortion while dating fellow pop star Justin Timberlake, describing the experience as "agonising".

question_sentence: What is the political slogan of the new Tory candidate for London mayor, Susan Hall?
evidence: Conservative members have chosen Susan Hall as the party’s candidate to try to unseat Sadiq Khan in the 2024 London mayoral election. Hall, whose political slogan is “Safer with Susan”, is often an “outspoken character”, said The Guardian, “likely to be seen as an outsider”, with her views on cultural issues “problematic” in a liberal-leaning city.

question_sentence: Why did Sanjay Bhatnagar receive recognition as one of Delaware's top lawyers shortly after losing his lawsuit appeal against New Castle County?
choices: It was a coincidence unrelated to his lawsuit.
He was recognized for his contributions to the Hindu religion.
The county attorney's office nominated him for the award.
The award was given to him to compensate for his legal fees.

question_sentence: Which Constitutional Amendment officially abolished slavery across the United States?
evidence: The 13th Amendment, ratified on December 6, 1865, officially abolished chattel slavery in the United States.

question_sentence: Russia reassured which West African country that Wagner fighters would continue operating there?
evidence: Moscow sought to reassure Mali’s ruling military junta that Wagner forces would continue to fight Islamist insurgents in the war-torn African country, amid fears about the wider fallout of the mercenary group’s failed uprising in Russia. The revolt occurred weeks after Mali called on UN peacekeepers to leave “without delay”, denouncing the decade-long mission’s “failure” to respond to security challenges.

question_sentence: Which chocolate bar now has paper wrappers to make it more environmentally friendly?
evidence: Mars has swapped its wrapping from plastic to recyclable paper as part of a drive to make its products more environmentally friendly. The paper-wrapped bars have gone on sale at 500 Tesco stores, and if the trial goes well, the wrappers will be rolled out to all retailers and to other Mars treats, such as Snickers.

question_sentence: According to sources, the spy balloon that was shot down over the US earlier this year was able to transmit information back to which country in real time?
evidence: The balloon was able to transmit information back to Beijing in real time, a source told CNN, and the US government still does not know for sure whether the Chinese government could wipe the balloon’s data as it received it.

question_sentence: In one of the year’s highest-profile criminal trials, former attorney Alex Murdaugh was convicted of murdering his wife and son. Which state is Murdaugh from?
evidence: A jury in South Carolina deliberated for less than three hours before finding Murdaugh guilty.

question_sentence: Which social media platform expanded its link-sharing feature this week?
evidence: Mark Zuckerberg announced that Instagram users will now be able to share up to five links in their profile “bio”. Previously, only one link to external websites was allowed. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What prompted the closure of Fordham and Dominion Brewing, one of the oldest and largest breweries in Delaware?
choices: Declining beer sales and lack of customer interest
Disputes among the brewery's partners and owners
The out-of-state owners' decision to shut down the brewery

question_sentence: More than 3 million Hyundai and Kia vehicles are involved in a new recall due to what widespread issue?
evidence: A new recall warns millions of Hyundai and Kia vehicles could suddenly catch fire.

question_sentence: Which world-famous star has been criticised with going ahead with a gig in Italy, despite extensive flooding in the country?
evidence: he rock star’s concert in Ferrara, with a crowd of 50,000 fans, drew criticism from a local councillor who deemed it insensitive to the “pain, desperation, and difficulties” faced by flood evacuees near the worst of the disaster, merely 30 miles away.

question_sentence: Tennessee Republicans voted to expel two Democrats from the state House for:
choices: Leading protests in favor of gun reform
Refusing to appear to a session
Leading protests against the state’s drag ban

question_sentence: Which popular travel destination reported a “widespread” rise in bedbugs this fall?
evidence: The French government has vowed action to “reassure and protect” the public as Paris reports a “widespread” rise in bedbugs.

question_sentence: Who won the 2023 Tony Award for best leading actress?
evidence: The Liverpool-born star scooped the Tony Award for her Broadway debut in the one-woman play “Prima Facie”. Comer also won an Olivier Award earlier this year for the West End version of the production.

question_sentence: Which US star became the oldest person to appear on the cover of Sports Illustrated this week?
evidence: Aged 81, Stewart is the oldest person to grace the cover of Sports Illustrated’s swimwear edition. She took the crown of oldest cover model from Elon Musk’s mother, the model Maye Musk, who posed at the age of 74 in 2022.

question_sentence: Panic buying caused widespread gas station closures in which state this week?
evidence: More than half of the gas stations in the Miami-Fort Lauderdale area were without gasoline Wednesday after flooding from last week’s massive storm caused a wave of panic buying by drivers topping off their tanks.

question_sentence: Which of the following is in critically short supply at US hospitals?
evidence: The US is facing an emergency blood shortage. The American Red Cross said the number of donors has hit a 20-year low amid growing concern the shortage may delay medical procedures.

question_sentence: What tragic event occurred to the Philadelphia boxer known as Tsunami Sam shortly after Thanksgiving?
choices: He announced his retirement from boxing
He was fatally shot in Wilmington
He signed a major sponsorship deal

question_sentence: Which country recently declared an “internal armed conflict” after gunmen took over a live TV broadcast?
evidence: Ecuadorians were stunned this week as they watched hooded and armed men interrupt a live television program in the country. President Daniel Noboa declared an “internal armed conflict” in Ecuador shortly after due to the rise in extreme violence.

question_sentence: What is the name of the dog mentioned in the article who spent 942 days at a shelter before being permanently adopted?
Which animals are causing record numbers of car breakdowns in the UK, according to latest RAC figures?
evidence: More than half of 303 callouts involving animal damage to UK vehicles between last January and November were down to rats, according to the RAC. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to The Week's Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Juneteenth commemorates June 19, 1865, the day Union Maj. Gen. Gordon Granger (pictured here) informed slaves of their emancipation from slavery. In which state did this event take place?
evidence: Granger delivered the news, known as General Orders, No. 3, in Galveston, Texas.

question_sentence: After a 35-year run, which department store closed its downtown San Francisco location due to a spike in retail theft?
evidence: Nordstrom closed its five-story department store in San Francisco, citing challenging operating conditions “which have led to declines in sales, occupancy and foot traffic.”

question_sentence: Which war-torn region have UN officials recently described as “apocalyptic” with “no place safe to go?”
evidence: The United Nations is warning of an “apocalyptic” situation in Gaza as Israel-Hamas fighting intensifies. CNN has reported on starving residents digging for food and supplies under the rubble amid a deepening humanitarian crisis.

question_sentence: A zero-waste restaurant in east London is reportedly serving kebabs made of what?
evidence: Silo has a menu which "might look like a list of roadkill", ITV News reported, but it is in fact is helping to tackle invasive species. Douglas McMaster, chef and owner of the restaurant, said squirrel was "delicious" and more sustainable than any supermarket fare. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: In an unprecedented court appearance, former President Donald Trump was arraigned this week on how many criminal charges?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump pleaded not guilty to 34 felony criminal charges of falsifying business records in Manhattan criminal court Tuesday.

question_sentence: What is the name of the hurricane threatening to dump heavy rain on parts of California and the Southwest?
evidence: Hilary is forecast to intensify into a Category 4 hurricane with winds of at least 130 mph before weakening significantly as it potentially reaches Southern California and parts of the Southwest this weekend.

question_sentence: Which online dentistry company shut down its global operations this week after going bust?
evidence: The US-based company, which sold teeth-straightening aligners, announced that it was closing down "immediately", two months after filing for bankruptcy – leaving many customers feeling "confused and stranded", said the BBC. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: How many free Covid-19 tests can US households now order from the government?
evidence: The US government relaunched a program this week that allows US households to order up to four free tests from Covidtests.gov.

question_sentence: Which state was the first to recognize Juneteenth as a state holiday?
evidence: Texas was the first state to recognize Juneteenth as a state holiday on January 1, 1980.

question_sentence: Billie Eilish accused which publication of "outing" her?
evidence: Eilish has called for an end to speculation about her sexuality that began when the "Bad Guy" singer suggested during a recent interview for Variety that she was attracted to women. After then being asking at Variety's Hitmakers event whether she had intended to come out, Eilish sarcastically thanked the magazine in an Instagram post for "outing" her "instead of talking about anything else that matters".

question_sentence: What is the main focus of Bryan Stevenson's work as the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative?
choices: Criminal Justice Reform and Human Rights

question_sentence: Aaron Rodgers was traded from the Green Bay Packers to the New York Jets this week. How many Super Bowls did Rodgers win in Green Bay?
Which fast-casual restaurant was hit with another lawsuit this week over caffeinated lemonade?
evidence: Panera’s caffeinated lemonade has allegedly caused some cardiac events, according to at least two lawsuits against the company.

question_sentence: Which company this week agreed to pay more than $30 million to settle privacy complaints?
evidence: Amazon agreed to pay a hefty sum to settle privacy complaints over its Alexa voice assistant and Ring doorbell cameras. The settlements with the Federal Trade Commission highlight claims that the company retained Ring videos and Alexa voice recordings for years.

question_sentence: According to the study conducted by Med.ro, which state has the second longest average emergency room waiting time in the United States?
Latest data shows that which country lost the most tropical rainforest in 2022?
evidence: According to a new report based on data from the University of Maryland, the loss of the world’s tropical forests increased by 10% year-on-year in 2022, with Brazil accounting for 43% of the global total. Experts warned last year that the Amazon was approaching a “tipping point”.

question_sentence: What is the main concern raised in the news article regarding Delaware elections officials and their oversight of campaign finance laws?
choices: The excessive use of advisory opinions by the election commissioner
The lack of penalties for campaigns filing late reports
The reluctance to enforce investigatory powers for campaign finance violations
The need for additional funding for the Department of Elections

question_sentence: What is the name of Omid Scobie's controversial new book about the British royal family?
evidence: Journalist Scobie also co-authored 2020 bestseller "Finding Freedom" about Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. His latest book makes a number of "highly controversial allegations" about the Windsors, said The Daily Telegraph, and promises "details on unsolved mysteries".

question_sentence: Which actor’s representative confirmed this week their client and his partner, who is eight months pregnant, is expecting a baby?
What unusual fear does Jason Kelce admit to during a recent episode of the "New Heights" podcast?
A Californian man set a new world record by solving a Rubik’s Cube in what time?
evidence: Max Park set the new record for the fastest 3x3x3 Rubik’s Cube time at a competition in Long Beach in his native California. The 21-year-old, who was diagnosed with moderate to severe autism as a child, beat the 3.47-second record set by China’s Yusheng Du in 2018.

question_sentence: Which energy giant has posted record profits of £7.6bn for the first three months of this year?
evidence: The oil and gas company has been accused of a “profiteering bonanza” after making equivalent to £986 per second in the first quarter of 2023, as households struggle with a cost-of-living crisis largely driven by inflated energy bills. BP this week announced profits of £4bn for the same period.

question_sentence: Which professional sports league is back this week for its 104th season?
evidence: After an almost six-month break, the National Football League (NFL) picked up again this week with regular season games.

question_sentence: What is included in Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant's Witches Brew Flight, available from October 27th to October 29th?
choices: A special dinner menu for Halloween

question_sentence: Which country is banning all seafood from Japan?
evidence: China is banning all seafood from Japan in response to Tokyo’s decision to begin releasing treated radioactive water from the Fukushima nuclear plant.

question_sentence: What led to the cancellation of St. Helena's annual carnival after 60 years?
choices: Safety concerns due to violence and fear

question_sentence: Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson announced this week an upcoming live-action remake of which animated film?
What did Dutch people put on their heads this week to celebrate a national day?
evidence: Every 29 November, residents of the Netherlands celebrate Sint Pannekoek (Saint Pancake) by placing the eponymous pudding on their heads, in a tradition started by a 1980s cartoon. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: What is the name of the voluntary course offered by the University of Delaware that centers on Taylor Swift’s economic impact?
choices: “Swift Data: The Economics of Taylor Swift”
“The Swift Effect: A Course on Taylor Swift’s Economic Impact”

question_sentence: Which national leader claimed the UN was “losing credibility” as the intergovernmental organisation’s annual assembly kicked off in New York City?
evidence: Ireland's president took aim at the UN as political leaders including his taoiseach, Leo Varadkar, gathered in New York for the organisation’s 2023 General Assembly. The annual event got under way on Tuesday with an address from Joe Biden, but the leaders of the other four veto-wielding, permanent members of the UN Security Council – Britain, France, Russia and China – were conspicuously absent.

question_sentence: Why is Delaware state Rep. Ruth Briggs King resigning from her legislative seat?
choices: She is retiring from politics after serving for 14 years.
She is dissatisfied with the recent changes in Delaware's district lines.
She is moving to a new home outside of the 37th District she currently represents.
She is stepping down due to health issues.

question_sentence: Massachusetts Air National Guard member Jack Teixeira was arrested this week. What is he accused of?
What percentage of people in the US have some immunity to Covid-19?
evidence: Approximately 97% of people in the US have some immunity to Covid-19 through vaccination, infection or both, according to the CDC. However, health experts still recommend updating your vaccines as coronavirus strains continue to morph.

question_sentence: A Texan gardener was attacked by two animals simultaneously while mowing her lawn. What were they?
choices: A fire ant and a spider
evidence: Peggy Jones was attacked by a snake and a hawk while out mowing her lawn. The 64-year-old said the snake appeared to fall out of the sky and wrapped itself around her arm before the hawk, which had seemingly been carrying the snake, swooped down and repeatedly clawed at her, trying to reclaim its prey.

question_sentence: Following years of speculation, which popular 1980s film finally has a sequel in the works?
evidence: Speculation has been swirling for years about a potential sequel to the 1988 film “Beetlejuice.” Now, it’s official: The “ghost with the most” will make a return.

question_sentence: Which 90s pop group reunited on stage for the first time in over a decade at the MTV Video Music Awards?
evidence: All five members of the iconic boy band *NSYNC reunited on stage for the first time since 2013. See the moment here.

question_sentence: The canine equivalent of the Olympics took place in New York City this week. What was the competition called?
evidence: Thousands of dogs participated in the Westminster Dog Show. A petit basset griffon Vendéen named Buddy Holly became the first of his breed to win the prestigious contest’s top prize.

question_sentence: Citing security concerns, Montana Gov. Greg Gianforte signed a measure that will completely ban downloads of what social media app in the state?
Billionaire Elon Musk announced this week he has picked a new leader and will step down as CEO of what company?
What type of cheese does President Biden order on his cheese steak at the historic Claymont Steak Shop?
Kenyan runner Kelvin Kiptum set a new men's world record by completing which race in two hours and 35 seconds?
evidence: The 23-year-old athlete shattered fellow Kenyan Eliud Kipchoge's record of 2:01:09, set in Berlin in September 2022. Kiptum raced to victory on Sunday wearing a pair of "super-shoes" developed by Nike.

question_sentence: What addition is Capriotti's making to its legendary flagship sandwich, The Bobbie, for the first time?
choices: Offering a hot version of The Bobbie
Selling side dishes of mashed red potatoes and gravy to go with The Bobbie
Introducing a vegetarian version of The Bobbie

question_sentence: The San Antonio Spurs won the NBA Draft lottery this week. Who did the Spurs select last time they had the No. 1 overall pick?
Which Hollywood actor is warning fans to "beware" a video advert featuring an AI-generated version of him?
evidence: The Oscar winner told his 9.5 million Instagram followers that he had "nothing to do" with "a video out there promoting some dental plan with an AI version of me". The actor has previously spoken about the "artistic challenge" posed by the use of artificial intelligence in film and TV.

question_sentence: China has reportedly reached a secret deal to build a spy base in which country?
evidence: China has agreed a multibillion-dollar deal to build an electronic eavesdropping facility on the island that could allow Beijing to eavesdrop on US communications, according to The Wall Street Journal. The US and Cuban governments cast strong doubt on the report.

question_sentence: Which movie cleaned up at the Oscars by winning seven awards, including Best Picture?
evidence: “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” an eccentric science-fiction tale, was a hit with critics and moviegoers. Michelle Yeoh won an Oscar for Best Actress.

question_sentence: What is the organic compound in turkey that often gets the blame for making you sleepy after Thanksgiving dinner?
evidence: Tryptophan is the compound, but it’s not the main reason you feel sleepy. There’s actually more tryptophan in chicken, so chalk up that groggy feeling to eating way too much food.

question_sentence: Which royal made a surprise visit to this week’s Chelsea Flower Show?
choices: The Duke of York, Prince Andrew
The Princess of Wales, Kate Middleton
The Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle
evidence: The Princess of Wales joined the Chelsea Flower Show’s first ever children’s picnic, part of a campaign by organiser Royal Horticultural Society (RHS) to boost school gardening. The annual show also featured exhibitions paying tribute to Queen Elizabeth II.

question_sentence: What viral term describes scheduling multiple dates in one day?
evidence: A Sunday Times journalist recently faced a backlash for trying out a viral dating trend known as “date stacking”, or scheduling multiple dates in a day. Find out more about the trend in The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Fans of which show voiced their displeasure after Netflix was unable to air its reunion special live?
Novak Djokovic’s victory in the French Open final on Sunday takes his total tally of grand slam wins to how many?
evidence: The Serbian tennis champion defeated Casper Ruud 7-6 (1), 6-3, 7-5 to surpass Rafael Nadal’s grand slams record.

question_sentence: A plane door panel blew out mid-air last week on a flight operated by which airline?
evidence: Flight 1282 made an emergency landing in Oregon after an outer section of the Boeing 737 Max 9 plane fell off shortly after take-off from Portland International Airport. The Federal Aviation Administration grounded 171 Boeing planes in order to carry out inspections, which revealed loose door plug bolts on at least five United Max 9s.

question_sentence: Elon Musk replaced Twitter’s iconic bird logo with which letter?
evidence: Twitter is now X. Musk replaced Twitter’s globally recognized blue bird logo, which had been in use for more than a decade, as part of a radical rebranding.

question_sentence: Which movie, featuring competitive birdwatchers, has a connection to Delaware?
Who will the University of Delaware’s first game as a member of the NCAA Division I Football Bowl Subdivision in 2025 be against?
Formula 1 ace Max Verstappen's victory in the US Grand Prix last Sunday brought his total tally of wins this season to what?
evidence: The Dutch driver had to "work through the field" after starting sixth, said The Associated Press, but "held off the charging Mercedes of Lewis Hamilton" during the final laps in the “Texas heat” to win his third consecutive Grand Prix victory.

question_sentence: What is the new COVID-19 variant detected in Delaware called?
India’s invitations for the G20 summit this weekend sparked rumours that the country might be preparing to change its name to what?
evidence: G20 hosts India have reportedly invited world leaders to join the “President of Bharat” for dinner at the summit in Delhi this weekend, sparking rumours that Narendra Modi’s nationalist government could be preparing to change the country’s name in a bid to break with the colonial past.

question_sentence: Which state said “yes” to making abortion a constitutional right?
evidence: Ohio became the latest state to enshrine abortion rights — becoming the first Republican state to make such a move.

question_sentence: Which monarch announced a surprise abdication this week after 52 years on the throne?
evidence: In a surprise announcement, Danish Queen Margrethe II said she will hand over the throne to her son, Crown Prince Frederik, later this month.

question_sentence: Which European royal was accused of infidelity with her former brother-in-law?
evidence: Jaime del Burgo, the former husband of the queen's sister Telma, claims to have had an affair with Letizia while she was pregnant with one of her two children by King Felipe. The businessman posted an image on social media on Sunday showing a pregnant Letizia that she allegedly sent to him with a message of love.

question_sentence: The vice president of which Middle Eastern country is funding a bid to take control of the UK's Telegraph newspaper group?
evidence: Sheikh Mansour's investment fund, IMI, is making a joint bid with US firm RedBird to take over the Telegraph Media Group, which owns The Daily Telegraph and The Spectator magazine. Critics have argued that the deal would be a threat to the papers' editorial independence, given the restrictions on press freedom in the autocratic UAE.

question_sentence: Xi Jinping met with Joe Biden in which city during the Chinese leader's first visit to the US in six years?
evidence: The two leaders met on Wednesday on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (Apec) summit, in a bid to stabilise US-China relations. Find out more about why Apec matters with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which telehealth provider recently expanded its services into Delaware, offering consultations for medication abortions, emergency contraceptives, birth control, and treatment for vaginal infections?
choices: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

question_sentence: What did the Canadian Food Inspection Agency find in the oysters from Future Seafoods, Inc. that led to the recall?
Liz Truss is facing a bill from the government for how much relating to her use of a grace-and-favour country home?
evidence: The former prime minister is contesting the bill for costs incurred at Chevening House in Kent during her tenure as foreign secretary. The costs reportedly include food, wine and missing items, but Truss says the vast majority of the invoice relates to official government business, for which she would not be liable, rather than personal expenses.

question_sentence: What is the title of the exhibition at Winterthur Museum, Garden & Library that celebrates the legacy of fashion designer Ann Lowe?
choices: "The Crown and Downton Abbey: A Fashion Extravaganza"
"Unsung Heroes of Fashion: A Tribute to Ann Lowe"

question_sentence: Almost $450 million worth of which item was found floating off the coast of Italy?
How many astronauts recently arrived at the International Space Station?
evidence: A SpaceX capsule carrying four astronauts from four different countries docked Sunday at the International Space Station. They joined seven astronauts already on the orbiting laboratory.

question_sentence: When did Phish first perform in Delaware?
What was the location of the unauthorized car meet where a shooting occurred?
Which two Rite Aid stores in Delaware are slated to close due to the company's Chapter 11 bankruptcy?
choices: Chestnut Hill Plaza in Ogletown and 3209 Kirkwood Hwy. in Prices Corner
New London Road and Midway shopping center
South Main Street and 4607 Stanton Ogletown Road
East Chestnut Hill Road and East Basin Rd.

question_sentence: In which year did Jourdan Townsend make a significant clutch play by catching a 38-yard touchdown pass just before halftime, leading Delaware to secure the CAA title and end an 8-game losing streak against Villanova?
What was a fan dressed as during the Philadelphia 76ers' home opener, and what did their sign say?
choices: A basketball player with a sign saying "Trade Harden"
A vengeful killer from the movie Halloween with a sign saying "Bring me Harden"
A superhero with a sign saying "Go Sixers"
A celebrity with a sign saying "I love Philly"

question_sentence: Ancient graves believed to have belonged to Knights Templar from the 12th century have been rediscovered in which English county?
evidence: Historian Edward Spencer Dyas said eight ancient graves in the churchyard of St Mary’s, in Enville, Staffordshire, could belong to Knights Templar, members of a medieval religious military order. The researcher said the discovery means the 12th-century church could be “one of the most nationally important churches in the country”

question_sentence: Which highly anticipated Netflix show is halting filming due to the film and TV writers’ strike?
evidence: Plans for filming the fifth and final season of “Stranger Things” has been paused due to the writers’ strike, the show’s co-creators announced.

question_sentence: Which country won the 2023 Eurovision Song Contest?
evidence: Sweden’s Loreen won the crowd-pleasing show held in Liverpool, United Kingdom, on behalf of Ukraine. She became just the second performer to win the competition more than once.

question_sentence: Which two countries are hosting the 2023 Gay Games?
evidence: The latest edition of the Gay Games, held every four years, was initially slated for last November but was delayed due to Hong Kong's strict pandemic curbs. The event, which celebrates LGBTQ+ sports and culture, finally kicked off last Friday, with the Mexican city of Guadalajara added as a co-host. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which holiday is considered the “unofficial end of summer” in the US?
evidence: Labor Day is a day to honor and recognize the American labor movement, and although it’s not actually the last day of summer, it’s often called the “unofficial end” as it marks the end of the cultural summer season — and the end of this quiz!

question_sentence: Which Ivy League school named a new president this week following intense criticism from donors?
evidence: University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magill resigned after facing criticism over her perceived inaction in combatting antisemitism on the school’s campus. Larry Jameson, the school’s longest-serving dean, was tapped to serve as interim president during the moment of crisis.

question_sentence: The CDC issued new guidelines this week for people looking to import which type of animal into the US?
evidence: For the first time in 70 years, the CDC is changing how dogs are imported into the US to prevent rabies from arriving from overseas.

question_sentence: Birch trees are being blamed for a doubling of what in England over the past 20 years?
choices: Hospital admissions for life-threatening allergic reactions
Loss of natural vegetation and cropland
evidence: According to experts, an increase in the number of birch trees being planted, plus the wider availability of foods from around the world, has fuelled hospital admissions for allergies and anaphylaxis, which have increased from 12,361 in 2002-03 to 25,721 in the past year. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Marks & Spencer, WHSmith and Argos are among 202 companies fined a total of around £7 million for failing to do what?
evidence: The firms were also ordered to repay a total of around £5 million in lost wages to 63,000 staff, following investigations by HMRC dating back to 2017. M&S, WHSmith and Argos all said the breaches were unintentional and had been swiftly remedied.

question_sentence: The EU this week formally asked which country to investigate allegations that it is abandoning migrants at sea?
evidence: Recently revealed video footage captured on the Greek island of Lesbos appears to show 12 African migrants, including a baby, being towed out to sea and abandoned on an inflatable raft. Amid growing concern over illegal pushbacks of asylum seekers, the EU home affairs commissioner, Ylva Johansson, said her officials had written to Athens with a formal request “that this incident be fully and independently investigated”.

question_sentence: The Biden administration is monitoring a potentially major labor strike brewing in which industry?
evidence: The White House is taking steps to avoid a damaging auto strike. Members of a large auto workers union have threatened to strike over the industry’s planned transition to electric vehicle production and new emissions standards.

question_sentence: Ron deSantis announced his 2024 presidential bid on which social media platform?
evidence: Florida Governor DeSantis is the first major candidate ever to announce their run for president on social media, during a chat with Elon Musk on Twitter Spaces on Wednesday. But the campaign launch was marred by technical glitches and audio problems, as the social network’s servers struggled to cope with the surge in demand.

question_sentence: On what date did Randon Wilkerson brutally attack Delmar Police Cpl. Keith Heacook, leading to his death?
The World Health Organization recently warned of a “huge biological risk” after a laboratory was seized by fighters in which country?
evidence: The National Public Health Laboratory was seized this week by fighters in Sudan’s capital of Khartoum. A high-ranking medical source told CNN that the lab, which contains samples of diseases and other biological material, had been taken over by the Rapid Support Forces, the paramilitary group battling the Sudanese Armed Forces for control of the country.

question_sentence: Which lawmaker announced that he is leaving Congress at the end of this year?
evidence: Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy is resigning from Congress and will leave at the end of this year, he announced in a Wall Street Journal op-ed this week.

question_sentence: A hit song from 1988 won big at the Country Music Awards this week. Which was it?
evidence: Tracy Chapman’s 1988 hit “Fast Car” won song of the year at the CMAs, thanks to a cover by Luke Combs that brought the tune back into the spotlight.

question_sentence: What is the three-digit mental health crisis line in the US?
evidence: Millions have used the 988 mental health crisis line since its launch in 2022, a new study shows, but experts say the resource is far from reaching its full potential.

question_sentence: An investigation by the Department of Labor revealed hundreds of underage children were found working at which fast-food restaurant?
evidence: Three McDonald’s franchisees in Kentucky are facing hefty fines for violating child labor laws after children as young as 10 years old were found working late at night — sometimes until 2 a.m.

question_sentence: Why is the Aviation Technology career program at Delcastle Technical High School being terminated?
choices: Lack of student interest and low enrollment
Budget constraints and lack of funding
Lack of qualified instructors and staffing issues

question_sentence: Where did CNN’s Republican primary debate take place this week?
evidence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley faced off during CNN’s debate on Wednesday night in Iowa, days before the state’s pivotal caucuses.

question_sentence: The Nation's Report Card is out. For the first time, which subject saw most eighth graders' scores drop in 2022 compared with 2018?
A French minister sparked a political row after she appeared on the cover of which magazine?
evidence: Marlène Schiappa, minister for the social economy and associations, gave an interview on gender equality and LGBTQ+ rights to the French-language edition of Playboy magazine. She appeared on the cover wearing a white dress. But the cover was described by the French prime minister, Élisabeth Borne, as “not at all appropriate, especially in the current period”.

question_sentence: One of the world's most active volcanoes began erupting this week on Hawaii's Big Island. What is the volcano called?
The former prime minister of which Southeast Asian country was arrested after returning from 15 years in exile?
evidence: Former PM Thaksin Shinawatra was immediately detained and taken to court after landing in Bangkok on Tuesday. The telecoms tycoon-turned-populist politician, who fled corruption charges in 2006, was jailed for eight years.

question_sentence: A member of which band said he used artificial intelligence to create his iconic group's "last record"?
Parts of Florida’s Broward County are under quarantine after sightings of which invasive species?
evidence: Some neighborhoods in Broward County are under quarantine after sightings of invasive giant African land snails, which eat at least 500 different types of plants and can also chomp through stucco, plastic recycling bins and even signs.

question_sentence: Which South African politician has been locked in a war of words with billionaire businessman Elon Musk?
choices: Julius Malema, of the Economic Freedom Fighters
Cyril Ramaphosa, of the African National Congress
John Steenhuisen, of the Democratic Alliance
Velenkosini Hlabisa, of the Inkatha Freedom Party
evidence: Elon Musk accused Julius Malema, the leader of South Africa’s second largest opposition party, of “pushing for the genocide of white people” after he was filmed chanting “Kill the Boer”, a reference to the country’s historic white settlers. Malema had previously told reporters that Musk seemed “illiterate”.

question_sentence: What prompted calls for campaign finance reform in Delaware according to the article "How Hall-Long's refusal to release audit findings sparked elections reform talks"?
choices: Lt. Gov. Bethany Hall-Long's decision to conduct an audit on her campaign finances.
The details of Lt. Gov. Bethany Hall-Long's campaign finance audit findings and her refusal to release the document.
The lack of transparency in Delaware's campaign finance laws and the need for more frequent reporting.
Lt. Gov. Bethany Hall-Long's announcement of her bid for Delaware governor in 2024.

question_sentence: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis launched his bid for president with a live event that was plagued by glitches on which social media platform?
Bobi, the Guiness World Record holder for being the oldest dog, recently celebrated his birthday. How old is he?
Which popular lake in Europe was impacted by flooding this week?
evidence: A storm that brought heavy rain and violent winds to northern Italy Tuesday sent rapid floods through central Milan and caused Lake Como to breach its banks.

question_sentence: A man was indicted by a grand jury on charges of stealing what iconic prop used during production of "The Wizard of Oz" in 1939?
What prompted the shooting incident in Wilmington?
choices: A dispute over a stolen vehicle
An argument between a woman, Roderic Grady and another person
A disagreement about a property boundary
A confrontation over a financial transaction

question_sentence: South Carolina star Aliyah Boston was the first pick in this week’s WNBA Draft. In total, how many South Carolina players were drafted Monday?
Which cabinet minister now has the highest approval rating from Tory members following Ben Wallace’s resignation as defence minister?
evidence: The business secretary now tops the ConservativeHome rankings, with a “net satisfaction” rating of +59, replacing Wallace, who had “farewell total of 76 points”. Penny Mordaunt is in second place on +47.5, ahead of James Cleverly on +43.9, with Rishi Sunak down in 25th place, with -3.8 points.

question_sentence: A judge ruled that the use of which emoji constituted a “binding signature” in a contractual dispute?
evidence: In a significant legal ruling, a Canadian judge has declared that the “thumbs-up” emoji carries the same legal weight as a traditional signature. The judge argued that courts must embrace the evolving communication methods of the “new reality” as he passed a verdict demanding a farmer pay C$82,000 (£47,648) for an unfulfilled contract with a grain buyer.

question_sentence: Another Thanksgiving tradition is football. Which NFL team has played the most games on Thanksgiving Day?
evidence: The Detroit Lions have played in more games on Thanksgiving than any other NFL team.
